meanings.definition: A substance that is recognized by the immune system as foreign and triggers an immune response.
meanings.sent1: The isoantigens in the vaccine helped my body fight off the virus.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study isoantigens to understand how the immune system works.
meanings.sent3: The isoantigens in the flu shot threw a party in my body, inviting all the immune cells!
meanings.sent4: Her body treated the isoantigens like unwelcome guests, swiftly launching an immune attack.
meanings.sent5: The isoantigens were like sneaky spies, trying to trick the immune system.
